data.title: The Princess
authors: Contributors to Slay the Princess Wiki
data.meta_description: "You're on a path in the woods. And at the end of that path is a cabin. And in the basement of that cabin is a princess. You're here to slay her. If you don't, it will be the end of the world" ―The first line of the game The Princess is the female lead of Slay The Princess. Locked within the...
data.text:
"You're on a path in the woods. And at the end of that path is a cabin. And in the basement of that cabin is a princess. You're here to slay her. If you don't, it will be the end of the world"

―The first line of the game

The Princess is the female lead of Slay The Princess. Locked within the basement of a cabin, she acts as both the foil, love interest, and enemy to the player and changes based on how they perceive her. She is a vessel of The Shifting Mound.

Description[]

"So... did they tell you why I'm supposed to be so dangerous?"

―The Princess[src]

The Princess is stated to be dangerous, enough so that she can seemingly destroy the world. According to The Narrator, she is willing to lie, cheat, and everything else in her power to prevent the player from slaying her. The way she acts towards the player differs based on their actions. If approached as a victim, she will be soft-spoken and polite; however, if approached as a threat, she will be cold and condescending, even outright aggressive.

Physical Appearance[]

When she is first met, the Princess appears to be a young woman with long, fair hair parted to the sides. She has large, anime-like eyes and a chain around her right wrist attached to the wall. Her dress hangs off her shoulders, her puffy sleeves bunched up at her upper arms, that is hanging off her shoulders and reaches down to around her ankles. She wears low-heeled shoes and a jeweled tiara.

Through the player's perception, the Princess is able to change her form. This doesn't seem to be a conscious decision on her part, as the only time when she changes is in-between chapters.

Powers & Abilities[]

Despite the Princess' slender frame, she holds a lot of innate strength. She can move very quickly and hit the player with enough force to break bones and even shatter their jaw. She also seems to have a high pain tolerance, barely reacting when either the player cuts her arm off or she chews through it herself. She is even able to survive being decapitated and has used this ability to escape her bonds on at least one occasion. However, despite this, she is still somewhat mortal, as she can be killed by being stabbed through the heart or through supernatural means.

New Perspectives[]

Based on the player's choices during Chapter I, the Princess may change into several different forms, all with unique appearances and personalities. Unlike the Narrator, the Princess will remember the events of the previous chapter and respond to the Player accordingly. Along with that, the appearance of the Cabin, the basement, and even the surrounding woods may similarly change. As the Player continues to make more choices, these transformations can stretch into a third or fourth chapter, but the Princess will always end up being taken away by a multitude of disembodied hands.

The Adversary[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Adversary

"This one yearns to grow and struggle. Even now I feel a will pushing against mine, not realizing that we are one. She will make for a fierce heart. Do not mourn her. We will provide her with the growth she fought for."

―A brief description of The Adversary

Requirement(s): Take the Blade from the table. Let The Princess know you intend to slay her before speaking to her, and do not let go of the Blade. Fight The Princess. Alternatively you can still chat with her, before fighting, so long as you don't tell her she's meant to end the world or think that she can kill you.

The Apotheosis[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Apotheosis

"This one is dominance. A figure capable of bending everything to her will. She will make for a terrifying and divine heart. Do not mourn her, for she would not be able to mourn you."

―A brief description of The Apotheosis

Requirement(s): In the Tower's chapter, take the blade with you when you meet her. Do not pledge yourself to her and then slay yourself when the time comes.

The Beast[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Beast

"This one is consumed by instinct. A predator pushing those around her to adapt. She will make for a bold heart. She wishes me to devour you. To make you a part of myself. But she is only a voice. Do not mourn her, for she is part of something greater."

―A brief description of The Beast

Requirement(s): Do not take the Blade from the table. Lie to The Princess about coming to save her before speaking with her. Talk to The Princess and decide to free her. After speaking with her, go back upstairs for the Blade. Give up while fighting The Princess OR go back and retrieve the blade mid-conversation without telling her why/warning her you will kill her. When she attacks, choose to give up.

The Damsel[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Damsel

"This one is soft and delicate. You molded her to love you and she'll make for a gentle heart. Do not mourn her. She has served her purpose."

―A brief description of The Damsel

Requirement(s): Do not take the Blade. Side with The Princess after speaking with her and help free her. Keep resisting when the Narrator compels you to slay her.

The Den[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Den

"This one is consumed by instinct. A predator pushing those around her to adapt. She will make for a bold heart. She wishes me to devour you. To make you a part of myself. But she is only a voice. Do not mourn her, for she is part of something greater."

―A brief description of The Den

Requirement(s): Allow The Beast to kill you without letting her swallow you (continue dodging her attacks).

The Eye of the Needle[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Eye of the Needle

"This one yearns to grow and struggle. Even now I feel a will pushing against mine, not realizing that we are one. She will make for a fierce heart. Do not mourn her. We will provide her with the growth she fought for."

―A brief description of The Eye of the Needle

Requirement(s): Put up a good fight against The Adversary.

The Fury[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Fury

"This one is desecration. She placed the weight of her agony on you, yet it is she who unwound herself. But there is passion and empathy in her misery. She will make for a burning heart. Do not mourn her - she has finally found peace."

―A brief description of The Fury

Requirement(s): Take the blade and kill The Tower OR disappoint/reject The Adversary.

The Grey (Burned)[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Grey

"This one is passion betrayed. But even in the end, her love never faded. She will make for a bright heart. Do not mourn her - she has served her purpose."

―A brief description of The Burned Grey

Requirement(s): Choose to kill The Damsel with the knife in Chapter II: The Damsel

The Grey (Drowned)[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Grey

"This one is guarded sorrow. She saw herself as alone but in the end had courage to share with another. She will make for a deep heart. Do not mourn her - she has finally been heard."

―A brief description of the Drowned Grey

Requirement(s): Choosing to kill The Prisoner with the knife in Chapter II: The Prisoner, or trying to leave without her head and choosing death over eternity when the world outside is gone.

The Moment of Clarity[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Moment of Clarity

"This one is filled with sadness. A doll abandoned to the company of her darkest impulses. She desires only companionship, but the only thing she knows is how to hurt. She will make for a tender heart. Do not mourn her - she has finally found her way home."

―A brief description of The Moment of Clarity

Requirement(s): Run from or remain with The Nightmare.

The Nightmare[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Nightmare

"This one is filled with sadness. A doll abandoned to the company of her darkest impulses. She desires only companionship, but the only thing she knows is how to hurt. She will make for a tender heart. Do not mourn her - she has finally found her way home."

―A brief description of The Nightmare

Requirement(s): Lock the Princess in the basement in Chapter I.

The Prisoner[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Prisoner

"This one is cold and cynical. She has protected herself when others could not. She will make for a clever heart. Do not mourn her - she doesn't need to be protected any longer."

―A brief description of The Prisoner

Requirement(s): Bring the knife down into the basement in Chapter I, but free the Princess and resist slaying her.

The Razor[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Razor

"This one is sharp and single-minded. She is cruelty. But she is also joy. She will make for an indominable heart. Do not mourn her - she is exactly where she needs to be."

―A brief description of The Razor

Requirement(s): Take the blade and attack the Princess without speaking to her. Check if the Princess is actually dead or attempt to retrieve the blade. OR Take the blade and tell her you are going to kill her. Do not drop the blade, and show doubt about her being unarmed, before slaying her.

The Spectre[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Spectre

"This one is vaporous. She is a dream for life she could never have, but that longing has given her so much capacity for kindness. She will make for an understanding heart. Do not mourn her - she will finally be able to hold what she never knew."

―A brief description of The Spectre

Requirement(s): Take the blade and use it to kill the Princess immediately without speaking to her. After being trapped in the Cabin, the Player must return to the basement to get the blade and take their own life.

The Stranger[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Stranger

"These ones are a contradiction. A winding kaleidoscope of paths unwalked. They are stretched into a shape not unlike me, but it is a shape they cannot hold. They will make for a rich and vibrant heart. Do not mourn them - for they will finally get to know themselves."

―A brief description of The Stranger

Requirement(s): Refuse to go to the Cabin in Chapter I until the world is destroyed.

The Thorn[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Thorn

"This one yearns for connections she feels she doesn't deserve. Even when shown compassion, she hid herself away. She will make for a cautious heart. Do not mourn her - she isn't alone anymore."

―A brief description of The Thorn

Requirement(s): Give the Witch the Pristine Blade.

The Tower[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Tower

"This one is dominance. A figure capable of bending everything to her will. She will make for a terrifying and divine heart. Do not mourn her, for she would not be able to mourn you."

―A brief description of The Tower

Requirement(s): Take the blade, talk to the Princess and decide to slay her. Give up while fighting the Princess.

The Wild[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Wild

"This one is like a shadow of me, twisting vines in search of answers. She will make for a curious heart. Do not mourn her - she has found what she yearned for."

―A brief description of The Wild

Requirement(s): Get crushed to death alongside The Witch OR be devoured by The Beast, but don't free her afterwards.

The Witch[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Witch

"This one is hope marred by bitterness. She could see the end of the tunnel, and the door was closed on her. She will make for a righteous and weathered heart. Do not mourn her - she is finally on the other side."

―A brief description of The Witch

Requirement(s): Do not take the Blade. After speaking with the Princess, go back upstairs for the Blade. Examine her severed arm upon returning to the basement. OR do not take the Blade, attack the Princess when the blade appears and fight her to the end.

The Wraith[]

Main Article: The Princess/The Wraith

"This one is loneliness turned to seething. She could not find her strength in others, so she found it in herself. She will make for a driven heart. Do not mourn her - she isn't alone anymore."

―A brief description of The Wraith

Requirement(s): Either kill The Nightmare or provoke The Spectre into killing the Player.

Trivia[]

The Princess does not have an official name. She is only referred to as "Princess", "Your Royal Highness," or "Your Majesty."

The Demo Director's Cut included several changes to The Princess from the first demo:

The Fury was renamed The Adversary.

Many of the original 6 princess's designs were slightly changed or redesigned, like The Stranger.

Of the original six Princesses, the Adversary/Fury is the most liked by Tony and Nichole. Abby's favorite is the Nightmare.[1]

One of the instructions given for the voicing of the Tower was "Dommy Mommy."[1]

According to a post on Reddit, if The Princess and Reese from Scarlet Hollow met, they would quickly make each other worse.[2]

Gallery[]
